intro: Sida lilloana, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats and is often found in marshy areas or along waterways. Its seeds are encased in a burs-like structure, aiding in seed dispersal by attaching to animals or clothing. Sida lilloana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
